strings.Value: "Yes, I killed them. Will you seek revenge?"
"You're wrong. They were already dead when I arrived."
"The Tiger Lords split up? Are you sure a new chieftain couldn't reunite them?"
"I see. Go. Speak with your god."
[Attack] "I'll send you to your god right now!"

{n}{d|Gwart}Gwart{/d} stands at the entrance to the tomb, surrounded by the bodies of the {g|Tiger Lords}Tiger Lords{/g} you've slain.{/n} "So, this is the tomb of the great chieftain. Would have been better if it had remained lost forever."
"{g|Gorum}Gorum{/g} himself guided me here. I didn't understand why he considered me worthy, until I saw the bodies. It wasn't Armag, was it? It was you."

{n}The young cleric takes a deep breath.{/n} "This place was once sacred to the {g|Tiger Lords}Tiger Lords{/g} — the final resting place of our greatest chieftain. Now it's just some hole in the ground, and the Tiger Lords are no more. There was a riot. It led the tribe to split. Armag sowed the seeds of fratricide, and the harvest we reap is discord. Our once great tribe has broken into several rival clans."
"No. I have no interest in revenge."
"As you say. It matters little now. I didn't come for revenge."

"I don't want to see my brothers and sisters killing one another. I want to take part in it even less. That isn't why I swore loyalty to {g|Gorum}Gorum{/g}. I came to this defiled sacred place of a broken tribe to spend some time alone with my god and think about all that's happened."

"I'm sure. The blood's been shed. Now each part of the tribe calls for vengeance — there's no thought of reunion. This is the end of the {g|Tiger Lords}Tiger Lords{/g}. Soon, other tribes will divide our lands among themselves, and we'll be scattered across {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g}."
{n}With a nod of farewell, Gwart disappears into the depths of the tomb.{/n}

"All that has occurred is the direct consequence of following the ways of your god. The fussy, proud god of war. But no matter how self-confident {g|Gorum}Gorum{/g} may be, all wars end the same way — with full burial mounds and the silence of abandoned tombs. In the end, {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g} ultimately triumphs — and only {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g}."
